main event: A reported sighting of a UFO near Houston, Texas on May 7, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as a round, silver or chrome-like color, with lights on the top and bottom that blinked in an irregular sequence.
The object was estimated to be 30-50 feet long and was first noticed about 1 mile away from the viewers.
The object exhibited unusual flight characteristics, appearing to move left, right, forward, and backward.
The object eventually disappeared by climbing away at an angle of about 45 degrees, with the object seeming to break up into bright lights before disappearing.
The sighting was observed by 5 witnesses, who viewed the object through binoculars, but no photographs were taken.
result: Probable reflection of ground lights caused by a strong inversion layer in the atmosphere.
sighted object: A round, silver or chrome-like object with blinking lights on the top and bottom.
location: North of Pasadena, near Houston, Texas
